title: Developing Comprehensive Socio-Spiritual Formation Capabilities Through Online Theological Education: Strengthening Civic Rights and Community Relationships

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced-level expertise in the field, extensive practical experience, foundational understanding of social systems and cultural diversity, and familiarity with basic concepts of civic rights and community relationship-building
context.additional_context: Online-asynchronous theology education design optimized for in-service practitioners. Operates through formative assessment-centered activities using personal devices and small-group collaboration. Includes project-based learning elements to strengthen social responsibility and community engagement, considering political, economic, and cultural contexts for local issue resolution

learning_goals: Learners systematically understand and explain theological concepts and social values (e.g., civil rights, community relationships, cultural diversity) through online learning materials and asynchronous discussions

Over six months, learners participate in biweekly online community discussions within companies (topic: linking theological values with social practices), achieving discussion engagement criteria (90%+ attendance rate, ≥5 contributions/session). They also submit monthly self-reflection journals (≥500 characters, meeting ≥4 of 5 rubric criteria) reflecting theological values (justice, love, forgiveness) and social practices, achieving ≥80% fulfillment in peer evaluations (average ≥4 on 5-point scale) and instructor feedback (≥4 points)

Learners analyze three real-world community cases (e.g., multicultural family conflicts, local elderly welfare issues, political minority rights promotion) over six months, applying pastoral skills (counseling, mediation, networking) and understanding of social systems to develop action plans. They achieve ≥4 points (out of 5) on institutional rubrics (problem definition clarity, contextual relevance, feasibility, cultural sensitivity) to propose field-applicable solutions
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
